comments.body:
Do the standard linting rules require this type of version? As far as I can tell, GPT doesn't follow that version pattern.

https://developers.google.com/doubleclick-gpt/versions

The standard linting rules do require this, yes.

```text
ERROR: 1:25  dt-header  Error parsing header. Expected: foo MAJOR.MINOR (Needs MAJOR.MINOR). See: https://github.com/Microsoft/dtslint/blob/master/docs/dt-header.md
```
If you need to change commas to semicolons, you may as well do it in all interfaces.
Every other interface already uses semicolons. This was the only exception.
